Ethnic Hilltribe Eco Trails - 2 Day Doi Inthanon

Experience a completely off the beaten track hiking trail in Doi Inthanon National Park, rich in fauna and flora. Incredibly scenic and non touristic. Here you will hike one of a kind special hiking trails. Hiking approximately 6 hours through the heart of the rain forests. Visit waterfalls, view points and even have the chance to see Gibbons in the Doi Inthanon National Park. and learn about the traditional herbal medicine used for centuries in home made saunas by the Karen Hilltribe. Our 2 day trails will take you to sleep in the Churkee Farm stay on the rice fields of a Karen Hilltribe Village in Doi Inthanon National Park. A farm stay that Ethnic Hilltribe Eco Trails, has helped build and do skills development in homestay building and management.

Quick Facts

Price: THB 2,800
Duration: 1 night 2 days
Meal(s): Meals
Difficulty: Medium, has a mix of uphills and downhills
Seasonal: November - February

More Info

Pick Up & Drop Off

Pick up 7.00 – 7.30 am. Arriving back to Chiang Mai around 18.30.

Included

Round transfer, guide, meals, water, park fees, accommodation, bedding

Not Included

Extra snacks or soft drinks.

What to Bring

Wear shoes with grip suitable for trekking and climbing, swimsuit for enjoying at the waterfall and pack a warm layer, mornings can be chilly at the summit.

Please support our mission by booking your trek directly with us on this site or by calling us instead of through a tour agency.

Highlights

  • Enjoy the beauty of waterfalls
  • Check out the scenic view point of Doi Inthanoon
  • Trekking in the untouched nature
  • Relax at Churkee Farm Stay
  • Experience traditional Karen herbal steam room

Itinerary:

  • Day 1: Pick up 8.30 – 9.00 am
  • Stop at a local market on the way to buy supplies and for a restroom break.
  • Drive to the Hoi Tong Karen Hilltribe village and head to the starting point of our hiking trail.
  • We will hike 3- 4 hours through the borders of the Doi Inthanon and Mae Wang National Park. Along the way we will stop at a beautiful a waterfall where you can swim and relax, experience the beauty of the rainforests fauna and flora and take in breathtaking views at the viewpoint. Stopping along the trail for lunch.
  • Arrive at the Churkee Farm Stay, where you will be sleeping for the night. Here we will relax and also show you the traditional herbal steam room where your guide will tell you about the medicinal herbs the Karen people have been using for centuries in these steam rooms. You will have a chance to enjoy the steam room and its health benefits if you like. Please feel free to make a donation to the Karen people.
  • If you are lucky we will see Gibbons or hear them barking, one of their home trees is 5 minute walk from the camp. They come to the tree when it is producing fruit. The best time to visit is early morning or late afternoon.
  • This family of Gibbons are protected by the Hoi Tong Karen Village which has allowed this group to prosper without fear of being hunted.
  • After the steam we will have dinner and relax around the fire.
  • Day 2: If you wake up early and would like to go see if the Gibbons are in the tree, we can take a walk to see.
  • After breakfast we will depart from camp around 9.30.
  • Our hiking trail will be about 4 hours this day and we will stop at 2 waterfalls along the way. Enjoying lunch along the way.
  • Arriving back to Chiang Mai around 16.00 – 17.00

Notes:

Ethnic Hilltribe Eco Trails - 2 Day Doi Inthanon

Practicing sustainable tourism and supporting family run businesses
